summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, particularly 1108 (1997) and 1292 (2000),
Recalling principles on safety of UN personnel,
Welcoming efforts on HIV/AIDS prevention in peacekeeping operations,
Welcoming the Secretary-General's report (S/2000/461) and endorsing its observations and recommendations,
Reiterating support for MINURSO's efforts to implement the Settlement Plan for a free, fair and impartial referendum,
Noting remaining differences between parties,
Decides to extend MINURSO's mandate until 31 July 2000, expecting parties to provide concrete proposals to resolve implementation problems,
Requests the Secretary-General to assess the situation before the mandate ends,
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
